name: Monstrous Mishap
description:
In this game you must defend your central base from an assortment of evil monsters you released by accident when trying to explore new realities. Luckily your cult have mastered the ablilities to transform into a range of objects with unique skills in order to fend off these feinds! However you only have a limited amount of cultists to use and transforming comes at a cost of your ritual power!

Controls:
WASD to move the camera.
Click on a tower icon at the top right to place a tower.
Move your cursor to where you want the tower to be placed.
Click once to begin rotating the tower, and click again to place it.
Right click at any time to cancel placing a tower.
Right clicking on a placed tower will remove it, you will only get money back if you delete it in the same build phase you built it in.

What can you transform your cultists into?

There are 4 different objects split into 3 classes.

Attack

-Plant - A close range fighter who does consistent damage.

-Traffic Cone - A Long range fighter who fires tiny cone missiles at enemies.

Defence

Box - cheap with high health but cannot attack.

Bookshelf - expensive with even higher health than the box, they will also attack when enemies are close.

Support

Tape - Cheap and heals all towers in a small area around it.

Toolbox - Expensive and can increase the attack of your towers or heal them but can only focus on one at a time.

Who will you be fighting?

There are 4 enemies that want to attack you.

Gazlo - the basic and most common enemy

Grulten - much faster than the Gazlo and has higher health

Goninga - Has a bin lid as a hat to protect it from the traffic cone 

Greaper -  explodes when it reaches your tower dealing damage to your towers

Grimbly - Too lazy to walk, so shuffles but will split into 2 Dinky Grimblys when killed

Dinky Grimbly - Quick with low health will only appear when a Grimbly is killed

Gremle - flies above most other classes and can only be hit by the cone, they will be blocked by the bookshelf and fall to the ground.

Made for the Godot Wild Jam #50

Music from the free music archive:
Kevin MacLeod - Impact Allegretto
Kevin MacLeod - Impact Prelude
Steve Combs - An Incident Occurs
